page.title: 15RIDING FOR THE DISABLED
page.content: In 1975 Miss Sue Wright and her father set up a centre for Riding for the Disabled at their home, Oastwood. The object of the Riding for the Disabled Association is to give the opportunity of riding to any disabled person who might benefit in their general health and happiness. Disabilities with which the group at Oastwood are familiar includes cerebral palsy, spina bifida, mental handicap, blindness and deafness. If the R.D.A. can help a few people to be less dependant on others and to lead a fuller and more satisfying life this is a rich reward indeed.
